Goodbye (lit. To see again)!: Do you (sg., informal) have the tickets?
How do we get (lit. drive) to Berlin?
That'll be (lit. That makes) five euros.
Are you free (lit. Can you) on Monday?
The man is looking at us.

Auf Wiedersehen!: Fritz ist sehr nett, ich mag ihn.
Goodbye (lit. To see again)!: Fritz is very nice, I like him.

Auf Wiedersehen!: Ich sehe euch heute Abend im Kino.
Goodbye (lit. To see again)!: I'll see you (pl., informal) at the cinema tonight.

Auf Wiedersehen!: Kann ich Sie morgen anrufen, Herr Hoffmann?
Goodbye (lit. To see again)!: Can I call you tomorrow, Mr. Hoffmann?

Auf Wiedersehen!: Sie ruft mich jeden Tag an.

Goodbye (lit. To see again)!: What time (lit. How late) is it?
Do you have time this evening?
I am in love with (lit. in) you!
I would like to reserve a room.
How much is (lit. What costs) a tea?
What would you like? (lit. You wish?)
How long will we be traveling (lit. drive)?
the ATM card, the debit card

Auf Wiedersehen!: Welche Schuhe suchst du? Ich suche die weißen. (die Schuhe)
Goodbye (lit. To see again)!: Which shoes are you looking for? I'm looking for the white (ones).

Auf Wiedersehen!: Welchen Hut nimmst du? Ich nehme den teuren. (der Hut)
Goodbye (lit. To see again)!: Which hat are you taking? I'm taking the expensive (one).

Auf Wiedersehen!: Welches Hemd willst du? Ich will das schwarze. (das Hemd)
Goodbye (lit. To see again)!: Which shirt do you want? I want the black (one).

Auf Wiedersehen!: Welche Bluse kauft sie? Sie kauft die rote. (die Bluse)
Goodbye (lit. To see again)!: Which blouse is she buying? She's buying the red (one).

Auf Wiedersehen!: Welchen Mantel hat er an? Er hat den dunklen Mantel an. (der Mantel)
Goodbye (lit. To see again)!: Which coat does he have on? He has the dark coat on.
the apple strudel with vanilla sauce
He wants to come along (lit. come with).
What are we having (lit. making) for breakfast?
seven hundred and fifty grams of butter
Do you like it? (lit. Does it taste to you?)
